thread.title: Music in diverse hues
thread.title_full: Music in diverse hues - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Music in diverse hues
text:
Parvaaz is a contemporary Indian music band, whose four members have assimilated several international rock influences but their own expression has a rootedness that makes their sound unique. They sing mostly in Kashmiri and Urdu and their own line-up reflects the diversity they come from.
The Bengaluru-based band comprises Khalid Ahamed (vocals), Kashif Iqbal (guitar), Fidel D'souza (bass) and Sachin Banandur (drums/percussions).
The band will perform live on September 17 (9 pm) at blueFROG, #3, Church Street.
